bug.author: chetanzope
bug.summary: Failing to create and API on Windows
bug.description:
Describe the bug Failing to create an api on windows , bentoml serve {saved_path} To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Failing with an error of the fnctl was not found fixed it by using this and creating a fcntl.py
<denchmark-code>def fcntl(fd, op, arg=0): return 0
def ioctl(fd, op, arg=0, mutable_flag=True): if mutable_flag: return 0 else: return ""
def flock(fd, op): return
def lockf(fd, operation, length=0, start=0, whence=0): return </denchmark-code>
Then the import pwd started failing , for which I dont have any work around till now .
Environment:
OS: [windows 10 ] Python/BentoML Version [Python3.6]
Additional context Add any other context about the problem here.

comments.comment: Thanks for reporting this issue <denchmark-link:https://github.com/chetanzope>@chetanzope</denchmark-link> ! We are working on a fix now, it was because we imported gunicorn which was only supposed to be used when running API server in linux/docker environment. Will update with PR soon, and it should go into next release, expecting early next week.

The fix has been merged, will update here again when the next release is out. Feel free to check out the master branch if you'd like to try out the fix. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/chetanzope>@chetanzope</denchmark-link>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ijbo>@ijbo</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/chetanzope>@chetanzope</denchmark-link> the fix is now in release 0.4.4, feel free to upgrade BentoML with !
Hi, it seems this bug is back in latest version (0.7.6) :-(

hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/harashm>@harashm</denchmark-link> , yes we noticed that too - it was reported here: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/bentoml/BentoML/issues/663>#663</denchmark-link>
And we have fixed the issue as well as adding CI test to prevent this from happening in the future: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/bentoml/BentoML/pull/665>#665</denchmark-link>
The fix will be released the coming Monday in version 0.7.7 Thanks!
hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/harashm>@harashm</denchmark-link> , just want to let you know, BentoML 0.7.7 is released now, windows support have been fixed.
